CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 3, 1956, pg. B10, reads: "Modern Sophisticates - The club, composed of six attractive young matrons, entertained a number of friends on its fourth anniversary at the home of Mr. and Mrs. John Martin of Wandless St. Cutting their cake, left to right, are Mrs. Ethel Jackson, Mrs. Mildred Chalmers, president; Mrs. Thelma Martin, Mrs. Rose Robinson, Mrs. Beatrice Hicks Williams, secretary, and Mrs. Virginia Taylor, treasurer. The Modern Sophisticates is a social and charitable club. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of six women from Modern Sophisticates Club cutting round cake, left to right: Ethel Jackson, Mildred Chalmers, Thelma Martin, Rose Robinson, Beatrice Hicks Williams, and Virginia Taylor, in Martin home on Wandless Street, another version
